private_information: Action clip requires facts: hand OBJ0, sneeze OBJ1, texture OBJ2, next OBJ1 OBJ2, next OBJ0 OBJ2.
Effect of clip: adds vase OBJ0 OBJ1 and removes next OBJ0 OBJ2.
clip_agent.goal: Provide a verified action model fragment for clip and report any ambiguities relative to public information and initial statements.

private_information: Action wretched requires facts: sneeze OBJ0, texture OBJ1, texture OBJ2, stupendous OBJ3, next OBJ0 OBJ1, collect OBJ1 OBJ3, collect OBJ2 OBJ3.
Effect of wretched: adds next OBJ0 OBJ2 and removes next OBJ0 OBJ1.
wretched_agent.goal: Provide a verified action model fragment for wretched and report any ambiguities relative to public information and initial statements.

private_information: Action memory requires facts: cats OBJ0, spring OBJ1, spring OBJ2, next OBJ0 OBJ1.
Effect of memory: adds next OBJ0 OBJ2 and removes next OBJ0 OBJ1.
memory_agent.goal: Provide a verified action model fragment for memory and report any ambiguities relative to public information and initial statements.

private_information: Action sip requires facts: hand OBJ0, cats OBJ1, texture OBJ2, next OBJ0 OBJ2, next OBJ1 OBJ2.
Effect of sip: adds vase OBJ0 OBJ1 and removes next OBJ0 OBJ2.
sip_agent.goal: Provide a verified action model fragment for sip and report any ambiguities relative to public information and initial statements.

private_information: Action paltry requires facts: hand OBJ0, cats OBJ1, texture OBJ2, vase OBJ0 OBJ1, next OBJ1 OBJ2.
Effect of paltry: adds next OBJ0 OBJ2 and removes vase OBJ0 OBJ1.
paltry_agent.goal: Provide a verified action model fragment for paltry and report any ambiguities relative to public information and initial statements.

private_information: Action tightfisted requires facts: hand OBJ0, sneeze OBJ1, texture OBJ2, next OBJ1 OBJ2, vase OBJ0 OBJ1.
Effect of tightfisted: adds next OBJ0 OBJ2 and removes vase OBJ0 OBJ1.
tightfisted_agent.goal: Provide a verified action model fragment for tightfisted and report any ambiguities relative to public information and initial statements.

private_information: Role: audit temporal and causal consistency, detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts, and produce an audit report of invariants and required bookkeeping removal.
Examples of bookkeeping shortcuts include ephemeral tokens, post-hoc penalties, and quotas that would mask causal violations.
auditor.goal: Audit the collection of action model fragments for temporal and causal consistency and produce a remediation report that removes bookkeeping shortcuts and documents necessary canonicalizations.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent model fragments and the auditor report to produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that achieves the stated goals.

public_information: Objects are named object_0 through object_13 inclusive.
Fluents available include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, collect, sneeze, spring, stupendous.
Actions available in the domain include paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with the preconditions and effects described by the agents.

State is expressed as ground predicates over the objects with binary predicates for relations such as next, collect, vase, and unary predicates such as hand and cats when used with an object argument as specified by agents.

model.system_prompt: You are an expert in action schema extraction and validation. Provide a compact structured JSON fragment describing the clip action parameters, typed preconditions, and typed add and delete effects. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on clarity and on any assumptions made.
model.prompt: Agent clip_agent. Use public information in environment and your private information to produce a validated action model fragment for clip. Identify unresolved naming ambiguities and dependencies on specific object instances. Provide one-line summary of temporal constraints required for safe composition.

model.prompt: Agent tightfisted_agent. Use public information in environment and your private information to produce a validated action model fragment for tightfisted. Identify unresolved naming ambiguities and dependencies on specific object instances. Provide one-line summary of temporal constraints required for safe composition.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert auditor for temporal and causal consistency in multi-action domains. Produce a structured audit report that validates causal links, flags cycles or missing causal links, recommends removal of bookkeeping shortcuts, and provides canonicalizations necessary for sound planning. Do not produce PDDL. Emphasize invariants and required changes to action fragments for compatibility with classical planners.
analysis.prompt: Agent auditor. Use the provided action model fragments to detect causal threats and temporal inconsistencies. Produce a remediation list describing which bookkeeping shortcuts to remove and how to canonicalize the action models so they are purely STRIPS or ADL compatible for compilation to FastDownwards.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL assembly and in producing planning problems for the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the validated action model fragments and the auditor remediation into a single coherent PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problem instances. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing action names with agent identifiers. Target FastDownwards compatibility by using STRIPS or ADL constructs that FastDownwards supports and by avoiding constructs requiring additional translators. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Agent orchestrator. Integrate the provided action model fragments and the audit report to produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem that achieve the stated goals from the statements. Produce a single domain and produce two problem instances corresponding to the two initial statement variants presented in the human specification. Ensure object naming matches environment public information and that all predicates are declared. Keep action names distinct by agent. Provide the PDDL domain and both PDDL problems for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and each problem in <problem></problem>.
